title: 12 Books to Read: The Best Reviews of June
sub_head: ‘Dangerous Ideas,’ ‘Dream Girl,’ ‘Helgoland’ and more of the books our reviewers highlighted this month.
body:
A selection of the month’s most noteworthy books, as discussed by The Wall Street Journal’s reviewers.
By Eric Berkowitz | Beacon
“We sorely need a reminder of the follies and crimes of censorship,” writes Jonathan Rose. To that end, journalist and lawyer Eric Berkowitz contributes a “global history that identifies some recurring patterns in the suppression of free thinking.” Though the author’s “faith in free expression is sorely tried by social media,” this is a volume that “ultimately comes down on the side of freedom.”
